title: DoD wants ‘resilient’ space systems, but how to get there is still unclear
summary: What it will take to make DoD constellations more resilient and achieve space superiority is still being debated, industry executives said.

title: SpaceX shifts resources to cybersecurity to address Starlink jamming
summary: Citing Starlink jamming “near conflict areas,” Elon Musk said March 5 that SpaceX will be "reprioritzed to cyber defense & overcoming signal jamming" at the expense of "slight delays" in Starship and Starlink V2.

title: Space Force to reorganize its acquisition command to ‘focus on the threat’
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command is being restructured in an effort to re-energize the bureaucracy and bring fresh focus on the competition with China, officials said March 4.

title: HawkEye 360 detects GPS interference in Ukraine
summary: Prior to the Feb. 24 invasion, HawkEye 360 noted increasing GPS interference near Ukraine.

title: Privateer unveils technology for improved tracking of space objects
summary: A new venture that emerged from stealth this week promises better information about objects in orbit and more tailored space situational awareness services for satellite operators.

title: SpaceX’s South Texas Starship factory prepares for major upgrades
summary: In what is probably a sign of things to come for SpaceX’s nascent Florida Starship factory, the company’s original Starbase facility in...

title: Rocket Report: Russia responds to Western sanctions, UK spaceport moves ahead
summary: "We are taking a close look at how the situation unfolds."

title: With Soyuz off the table, OneWeb back in the mix
summary: OneWeb is considering American, European, Indian and Japanese rockets for launching its remaining 220 satellites after the company announced March 3 that it would stop using Russia’s Soyuz rocket.

title: Air Force Secretary: We’re worried about Russia but China is a bigger strategic threat
summary: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said, "when you look at it objectively, China is a much greater strategic threat than Russia is"

title: U.S. Air Force sees no impact from Russia’s decision to cut off supply of rocket engines
summary: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said U.S. national security launches will not be affected by Russia’s decision to stop supplying rocket engines to the United States.
